intro: Pilosella orolegionensis, commonly known as the Andean hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, fluffy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pilosella orolegionensis is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
